OHBM Australia 2024 Awardees Announced!

Posted on September 26, 2024

Awardees: OHBM Australia 2024 üèÜ

This year, we were excited to introduce a new set of awards to recognize the outstanding contributions our members are making in the field of Human Brain Mapping. We are proud to announce the recipients of this year‚Äôs awards. Congratulations to all!


Early Career Researcher Awards:


Dr. Margaret Moore

Research Fellow, Queensland Brain Institute, University of Queensland

Dr. Moore‚Äôs current research combines methods from neuroscience and stroke neuropsychology to investigate the neural basis of both normal and abnormal human visuospatial perception.

Dr. Devon Stoliker

Postdoctoral Researcher, Turner Institute for Brain and Mental Health, Monash University

Dr. Stoliker has initiated and led Australia‚Äôs first psychedelic neuroimaging trial, which includes the largest sample size in psychedelic research to date.

Emerging Leadership Award:


Dr. Kerstin Pannek

Senior Research Scientist, Australian E-Health Research Centre, CSIRO

Dr. Pannek‚Äôs research program has made significant advances in neonatal and pediatric brain MRI by improving data quality and enhancing our understanding of normal and abnormal brain development.
